answers.answer: Hi,May I know what other medical problems you have? Do you have hormonal problems? Diabetes? Are you on steroids?History of asthma? History of trauma or cancer in the family.An elevated white blood cell count usually denotes an infection taking place in the body.Have you any fever,sore throat,pain in urination or any infected wound in the body? Your neutrophils ( a type of white blood cell) is usually associated with the acute or early phase of an infection or inflammatory process.Your test shows that the neutrophils predominate. An acute inflammatory and infectious process has to be ruled out. Are there any palpable masses in the body? any vomiting or back tenderness? Fever is sually associated with an ongoing infection.A peripheral blood smear is usually requested to visualize blood cell morphology and may shed some light.Associated weight loss, headaches, blurring of vision, easy bruising and appearance of lumps in the body may signal a more serious underlying condition.Please stay calm and wait for your physician to further evaluate you.Good Luck!

I have no symtoms, no problems.  I am very tired but associate that to having 4 kids.  I have a long standing history of high blood pressure do to my first pregnancy (eclampsia), but but is under control,my appendix was removed 13 years ago they found a carnoid tumor.  No big deal. Never spread.  But everything else is fine.

question: I recently saw my primary care physician for a general check up, no problems.  She did some blood work, twice to confirm the values;  I received a phone message from her stating I need to see an Endocrologist, my blood work came back the same and she needs to send me to a specialist???,and once I find one have him repeat the blood tests again.  That was it...... I called the office and she has left on vacation for two months and is unable to be reached.  Her office did fax me the blood test results.  I have made an appointment with the endocrologist but the first available(with all the docs in the area) was in in March.  It's driving me crazy to find out what all of the means.  Can somebody please help me.White Count was            (high) 18.6ALT  was                       (high) 48MVC was                      (high) 99Neutrophils  (absolute)    (high) 87Lymphs                         (low)  9Monocytes                     (low)  2
title: high white count
